attributes.action: We the undersigned residents of Craven District in the county of North Yorkshire petition the Prime Minister to: 'Acknowledge that Craven District Council as recently adjudged by the Audit Commission in its report on  the council’s ‘Use of Resources 2007/2008’ is no longer fit for purpose.’ This report accorded the council its two lowest-possible ratings.   Moreover, in addition to the council's current severe financial situation, the council has recently admitted that an unauthorized loan of £2 million was made by an unidentified council member/officer to an unidentified third party. The reason for this unauthorized loan and all other relevant details (including repayment requirements and interest) have been withheld from the majority of councilors, the press and the public; and an independent inquiry has been refused by council leaders and officers.  Accordingly, we also petition the Prime Minister to:  (a) Instigate an independent public inquiry into the circumstances which led to the Audit Commission’s condemnatory finding; plus full public disclosure of the circumstances surrounding the unauthorized loan.   (b) Require the council’s elected leaders, along with present and former salaried officers concerned with the council’s financial affairs are held to public account for their actions.'

attributes.background: The Audition Commission in March 2009 accorded Craven District Council its two lowest ratings. In addition to the council's present financial crisis, it is also investigating an unauthorized loan of £2 million by an unidentified council member/officer to an unidentified third party. The details of this loan have been withheld from the press and the public.
